TopicTitle: My brother is terrible at KSP. Hilarity Ensues.

Articles.Content:
So my brothers and I have a little YouTube channel we have some fun with. Recently they picked up Kerbal Space Program for the anniversary sale and we're planning on recording some sort of three-way challenges, but in the meantime, Will decided he would try and play the game on his own. The result is 20 minutes of him putting the wrong parts on everything and repeatedly firing Jebediah into the lower stratosphere with no hope of return.

I thought it was pretty funny.
I haven't even watched more then 10 seconds yet but I have to say you sound just like my math teacher!

Personal pet peeves of mine but could you guys not clutter the beginnings of your videos with annotations at the beginning of your videos? I literally have stopped watching channels that did that cause they annoy me a lot. ((And the option to turn them off doesn't exist on forum pages)As far as I can tell)

On other things, nice video. Watched a few others on your channel too. I'll come back in about a month and see if you guys made any progress.

Good luck and fly safe.

Thanks for the views and the feedback! This one was just my brother Will (who does not teach math unfortunately), but we'll be doing some videos with all three of us soon (may have to wait until after Christmas at this point). I'll talk to him about the annotations!
''Reminds me of spore'' so true ^^ Man I loved that game. Partly why I love KSP so much - freedom to build anything and everything the way you want to ^^
Just my little thought: Cuss words can be funny in moderation (especially after a big crash), but don't overdo it.
I skipped like fifteen minutes in and LOLd when he didn't know why the jet engines wouldn't work.
I have never seen anyone so hilariously bad at KSP. Thank god I wasn't like that!

I skipped like fifteen minutes in and LOLd when he didn't know why the jet engines wouldn't work.

"This has a parachute in it right?"Ã¯Â»Â¿ has to be my favorite.

And yeah. He does swear a bit too much. What can I say. We had lax parents.
